intro: Houlletia brocklehurstiana, commonly known as the Malagasy starfruit, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped fruits. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that develop into five-lobed, star-like fruits. Its leaves are palmately lobed and have a hairy texture. Houlletia brocklehurstiana is primarily found in humid, lowland areas with rich soil.
